notes.text: This CSAF advisory was extracted from unstructured data and may contain inaccuracies. If you notice any errors, please reach out to the designated contact at CISA CSAF: central@cisa.dhs.gov
notes.title: CISA Disclaimer

notes.text: Federico Maggi of Trend Micro reported this vulnerability to CISA.
notes.title: Summary

notes.text: No known public exploits specifically target this vulnerability.
notes.title: Exploitability

product.name: KUKA.Sim Pro: Version 3.1 simulation and machine-programming software is affected by this vulnerability

cwe.name: Improper Enforcement of Message Integrity During Transmission in a Communication Channel

notes.text: Simulation models for these devices are hosted by a server maintained by KUKA. When these devices request a model, the server transmits the model in plaintext.CVE-2020-10635 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 4.3 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:N/I:L/A:N).
notes.title: Summary

remediations.details: KUKA recommends upgrading KUKA.Sim Pro to Version 3.1.2 or above to mitigate this vulnerability. The update is provided for users with a licensed Version 3.1. Version 3.1 is the only affected version that is still maintained. All previous versions of KUKA.Sim Pro have been discontinued
remediations.url: Version 3.0 has been discontinued since the beginning of 2019.
